definition: animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)
to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including

sentences.english: Once firms become technology leaders, it is harder to unseat them.
sentences.chinese: 一旦公司成为技术的引领人物，想就革除很难了。

sentences.english: He is a person under the Pope's Ban.
sentences.chinese: 他是被罗马教皇革除教门的人。

sentences.english: You must forsake your bad habits.
sentences.chinese: 你必须革除你的坏习惯。

sentences.english: Bad habits should be got rid of.
To Abiathar the priest the king said, "Go back to your fields in Anathoth."
sentences.chinese: 所罗门就革除亚比亚他，不许他作耶和华的祭司。

sentences.english: The vice-mechsomeic prescribed the reviser to devise a computer device forgetting rid of vice.
sentences.chinese: 代理照拂建议校订者想出一个革除恶习的计谋。

sentences.english: We should certainly get rid of the evil traditions and customs.
sentences.chinese: 我们理所当然地要革除恶俗陋习。

definition: to dismiss from office/to ban/to reject
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
style of governing (of minor official)/achievement in office
to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
to punish (someone)/to take disciplinary action against (someone)
to dismiss from office/to resign from office
old system/weights and measures of former times
